entry.title: John Peckham has served six years in prison and fears his prison...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

John Peckham has served six years in prison and fears his prison sentence will become a death sentence. He hopes the Governor will reconsider making vaccines and safe release a priority. "You cannot self-distance, and that is why it spread so quickly in here," Mr. Peckham said.

entry.title: Fred Harris lost 20 years of his life because of the failed war...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Fred Harris lost 20 years of his life because of the failed war on drugs and sentencing failures in the criminal legal system. A massive systemic problem requires a transformational solution. Clemency can save lives and offer long overdue second chances. Redemption is real. https://www.9news.com/…/73-937fc010-4609-47b2-b2fe-f91fc69d…

If Fred Harris was convicted of the same crimes today, he'd likely only face about eight years in prison.

9news.com

After being sentenced to 96 years in prison for small drug charges he served 20, granted clemency and is free

If Fred Harris was convicted of the same crimes today, he'd likely only face about eight years in prison.If Fred Harris was convicted of the same crimes today, he'd likely only face about eight years in prison.

entry.title: The Aurora independent investigation report confirms in stark...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

The Aurora independent investigation report confirms in stark terms what the community has long understood: Aurora police killed Elijah McClain. Mr. McClain was the innocent victim of multiple violations of longstanding law that is supposed to limit the authority of law enforcement. The family of Elijah McClain deserves justice. The community is calling for accountability. Aurora decision-makers cannot and must not ignore these calls. http://acluco.org/3qO8NX5

February 23, 2021 DENVER – The following statement can be attributed to Mark Silverstein, Legal Director for ACLU of Colorado. “The Aurora independent investigation report confirms in stark terms what the community has long understood: Aurora police killed Elijah McClain. Mr. McClain … Continu...

aclu-co.org

ACLU of Colorado Statement on the Aurora Independent Investigation Into Elijah McClain’s Death | ACLU of Colorado

February 23, 2021 DENVER – The following statement can be attributed to Mark Silverstein, Legal Director for ACLU of Colorado. “The Aurora independent investigation report confirms in stark terms what the community has long understood: Aurora police killed Elijah McClain. Mr. McClain … Continu...February 23, 2021 DENVER – The following statement can be attributed to Mark Silverstein, Legal Director for ACLU of Colorado. “The Aurora independent investigation report confirms in stark terms what the community has long understood: Aurora police killed Elijah McClain. entry.title: Using an arbitrary system to decide which views and beliefs can...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Using an arbitrary system to decide which views and beliefs can and can’t be expressed clearly violates the First Amendment. We must hold HOAs and Metro Districts to the Constitution, and ensure that residents can exercise their right to free speech.

https://www.denverpost.com/…/aclu-lawsuit-free-speech-hoa-…/

The American Civil Liberties Union of Colorado filed a federal lawsuit Tuesday challenging neighborhood subdivision rules that prohibit residents from displaying certain flags and signs on their pr…

denverpost.com

ACLU sues Denver-area subdivision for barring pride flags, social justice signs

The American Civil Liberties Union of Colorado filed a federal lawsuit Tuesday challenging neighborhood subdivision rules that prohibit residents from displaying certain flags and signs on their pr…The American Civil Liberties Union of Colorado filed a federal lawsuit Tuesday challenging neighborhood subdivision rules that prohibit residents from displaying certain flags and signs on their pr…

entry.title: HOAs and Metro Districts shouldn’t have the authority to...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

HOAs and Metro Districts shouldn’t have the authority to arbitrarily approve or deny individuals the right to express views and beliefs without consultation of a fixed set of guidelines that apply to everyone. HOAs and Metro Districts must be held to constitutional standards, just like larger units of government — and the Colorado legislature must be responsible for ensuring that they don’t have the power or ability to violate individuals’ First Amendment rights. Read the full press release: https://aclu-co.org/aclu-challenges-subdivision-rules-proh…/

entry.title: Born in 1862, Ida B. Wells was an investigative journalist,...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Born in 1862, Ida B. Wells was an investigative journalist, teacher, civil rights activist, and one of the founders of the NAACP. The ACLU of Colorado celebrates the legacy of Ms. Wells, and continues to work toward preserving and extending constitutionally guaranteed rights to people who have historically been denied them on the basis of race. #BlackHistoryMonth

entry.title: When HOAs attempt to regulate a neighborhood’s signs or flags,...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

When HOAs attempt to regulate a neighborhood’s signs or flags, they strip residents of their constitutionally protected right to free speech. Coloradans should be allowed to express their views and beliefs, no matter their political nature, uninhibited by and without retribution from their HOA.

https://www.westword.com/…/new-colorado-hoa-fight-over-blac…

The homeowners association fears contention among neighbors.

westword.com

Lafayette HOA Fight Over Black Lives Matter Sign Could Spur New Law

The homeowners association fears contention among neighbors.The homeowners association fears contention among neighbors.

entry.title: In 2019, 65% of immigrants who navigated deportation cases in...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

In 2019, 65% of immigrants who navigated deportation cases in Aurora did so without legal representation. Reports show that a statewide immigrant legal defense fund would not only benefit our immigrant community but also local and state economies.

https://www.westword.com/…/immigrant-legal-defense-fund-wou…

A statewide fund would cost $15.2 million annually, but pay off with $18.6 million in savings and revenues.

westword.com

Report Shows Positive Financial Impact of Immigrant Legal Defense Fund

A statewide fund would cost $15.2 million annually, but pay off with $18.6 million in savings and revenues.A statewide fund would cost $15.2 million annually, but pay off with $18.6 million in savings and revenues.

entry.title: Pauli Murray's work as a civil rights lawyer shaped the...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Pauli Murray's work as a civil rights lawyer shaped the foundations of early social justice movements. Her senior thesis, arguing against the "separate but equal" doctrine, would later be used in Brown v. Board to dismantle racial segregation in schools. #BlackHistoryMonth

entry.title: Colorado prisons have experienced some of the harshest impacts...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Colorado prisons have experienced some of the harshest impacts of COVID-19 statewide. Governor Polis must make public health and equity priorities, and ensure that our communities are safe through a comprehensive vaccine distribution plan for prisons.

coloradosun.com/2021/02/12/covid-prisons-vaccination-opinion

Gov. Jared Polis isn’t listening. So far he’s refusing to implement widespread vaccine distribution in prisons in phases 1b or 2 of Colorado’s distribution schedule — despite prisons being one of the settings hardest hit by COVID-19 in the state. There’s a consensus among many experts that...

coloradosun.com

Opinion: Polis must enact a COVID-19 vaccination plan for Colorado’s hard-hit prisons

Gov. Jared Polis isn’t listening. So far he’s refusing to implement widespread vaccine distribution in prisons in phases 1b or 2 of Colorado’s distribution schedule — despite prisons being one of the settings hardest hit by COVID-19 in the state. There’s a consensus among many experts that...Gov. Jared Polis isn’t listening. So far he’s refusing to implement widespread vaccine distribution in prisons in phases 1b or 2 of Colorado’s distribution schedule — despite prisons being one of the settings hardest hit by COVID-19 in the state. There’s a consensus among many experts that...

entry.title: Your data should always be protected when using government...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Your data should always be protected when using government services. We are urging lawmakers to support legislation establishing privacy protections that would require a warrant or subpoena to access personal data. Read more: http://acluco.org/3qcOwu5

The Colorado Immigrants Rights Coalition said it obtained more than 200 emails between the state agency and U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement agents. The advocacy group characterized the state employees

entry.title: The Larimer County District Court dismissed Adam Wiemold’s...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

The Larimer County District Court dismissed Adam Wiemold’s 2018 citation for  “camping” in his car, for its violation of the Eighth Amendment. This ruling must set the stage to end the unconstitutional camping bans that target people experiencing homelessness statewide.

https://www.westword.com/…/judge-tosses-fort-collins-campin…

He worked in a homeless shelter, but couldn't stay there.

westword.com

Judge Rules Fort Collins Camping Ban Case Violated Eighth Amendment

He worked in a homeless shelter, but couldn't stay there.He worked in a homeless shelter, but couldn't stay there.

entry.title: The DOC is failing incarcerated people with permanent...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

The DOC is failing incarcerated people with permanent disabilities and illnesses by disregarding their responsibility to save lives through special needs parole. They must take steps to safely release people who are at risk. This failure to act is fatal.

https://www.cpr.org/…/colorado-dept-of-corrections-special…/

Advocates, lawmakers: state isn't doing enough to get sick inmates out of prison before they die.

cpr.org

Advocates Call For Reform As ‘People Are Needlessly Dying In Prison’ During The Pandemic

Advocates, lawmakers: state isn't doing enough to get sick inmates out of prison before they die.Advocates, lawmakers: state isn't doing enough to get sick inmates out of prison before they die.

entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Únete a la lucha por los derechos civiles en Colorado. Estamos contratando a un Asistente Ejecutiva. Entérate más y aplica hoy en: https://aclu-co.org/about-us/work-aclu/

entry.title: Protecting and supporting our immigrant communities requires...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Protecting and supporting our immigrant communities requires actively using your power to uplift people through real, concrete change. Senator Hickenlooper must stop making empty promises, and ensure that his words coincide with decisive actions.

https://www.thedenverchannel.com/…/hickenlooper-says-he-rem…

On Monday, Colorado's Democratic National Committee delegation sent a letter to the state party chair calling for the public censure of freshman U.S. Sen. John Hickenlooper after voting in favor of an non-binding amendment that would block undocumented immigrants from receiving stimulus payments

thedenverchannel.com

Hickenlooper says he remains 'committed' to immigration issues after vote on stimulus payments

On Monday, Colorado's Democratic National Committee delegation sent a letter to the state party chair calling for the public censure of freshman U.S. Sen. John Hickenlooper after voting in favor of an non-binding amendment that would block undocumented immigrants from receiving stimulus paymentsOn Monday, Colorado's Democratic National Committee delegation sent a letter to the state party chair calling for the public censure of freshman U.S. Sen. John Hickenlooper after voting in favor of an non-binding amendment that would block undocumented immigrants from receiving stimulus payments

entry.title: In 2018, Adam Wiemold, an unhoused Fort Collins man, was charged...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

In 2018, Adam Wiemold, an unhoused Fort Collins man, was charged with illegal "camping" by Fort Collins Police for sleeping in his vehicle at a designated rest area. Today we announced that the Larimer County District Court ruled that the City of Fort Collins violated the Constitution when it prosecuted Mr. Wiemold. Read more about the court's decision: https://aclu-co.org/victory-in-fort-collins-court-rules-ca…/

entry.title: Join us on Thursday, February 11 at 12 p.m. for our annual...
entry.content:
ACLU of Colorado

Join us on Thursday, February 11 at 12 p.m. for our annual Legislative Preview.

Get engaged with our policy priorities and discover how you can collaborate with us this legislative session. You will hear from our Public Policy Director, Denise Maes, on our legislative priorities, which include criminal legal reform, immigrants’ rights, and more. We need your help to ensure Colorado continues to be a leader in civil right and civil liberties. This is a virtual event, and you are encouraged to bring your lunch!

RSVP: http://bit.ly/2LanmVp
